title: The Marías share their favorite spots on Google Maps
description: Google Maps is partnering with indie-pop group The Marías to share their favorite spots and help you get to their shows.
author: Google Maps Team<department/><company/>
excerpt: Google Maps is partnering with indie-pop group The Marías to share their favorite spots and help you get to their shows.
text: Google Maps is partnering with indie-pop group The Marías to share their favorite spots and help you get to their shows. Get ready to dive into the ethereal world of indie pop band, The Marías. The LA-based band, known for their dreamy songs in both English and Spanish like “No One Noticed” and “Lejos de Ti,” have kicked off the second leg of The Submarine Tour (Extended) in North America.To celebrate, the band curated an exclusive Google Maps list highlighting “dream spots” that inspire creativity. It includes everything from art galleries and green spaces to vintage shops and drive-in movie theaters. Discover more than 100 of the band’s favorite places across their tour cities including Albuquerque, Los Angeles, Raleigh, Tucson and Vancouver. Want to create your own list like The Marías? If you’re meeting friends before a show or finding a destination for a dinner out, you can use a list in Google Maps to rally your crew. Tap the “New list” button in the You tab, add a few options and share the link with friends. Then they can save places and vote on their top choices with an emoji reaction. See what places everyone's excited about and choose the perfect spot without all the back-and-forth.Plus, you can use Google Maps to get to The Marías’ shows — whether you’re driving, taking transit, walking, or cycling. Whether you're traveling to a Submarine show or planning a group hang, explore and discover all the spots that inspire The Marías on Google Maps. Related stories
html:
Google Maps is partnering with indie-pop group The Marías to share their favorite spots and help you get to their shows.

Get ready to dive into the ethereal world of indie pop band, The Marías. The LA-based band, known for their dreamy songs in both English and Spanish like “No One Noticed” and “Lejos de Ti,” have kicked off the second leg of The Submarine Tour (Extended) in North America.

To celebrate, the band curated an exclusive Google Maps list highlighting “dream spots” that inspire creativity. It includes everything from art galleries and green spaces to vintage shops and drive-in movie theaters. Discover more than 100 of the band’s favorite places across their tour cities including Albuquerque, Los Angeles, Raleigh, Tucson and Vancouver.

Want to create your own list like The Marías? If you’re meeting friends before a show or finding a destination for a dinner out, you can use a list in Google Maps to rally your crew. Tap the “New list” button in the You tab, add a few options and share the link with friends. Then they can save places and vote on their top choices with an emoji reaction. See what places everyone's excited about and choose the perfect spot without all the back-and-forth.

Plus, you can use Google Maps to get to The Marías’ shows — whether you’re driving, taking transit, walking, or cycling. Whether you're traveling to a Submarine show or planning a group hang, explore and discover all the spots that inspire The Marías on Google Maps.

Related stories
